summary: The Transportation Freedom Act (S. 711) mainly focuses on amending the Internal Revenue Code to offer tax deductions for automobile manufacturers that meet specific criteria (wage enhancement for workers) and repeals/modifies several environmental regulations. Key elements include repealing multipollutant emissions standards, CAFE standards rules, and vehicle emissions waivers. The bill also mandates the establishment of new CAFE standards and greenhouse gas emissions standards for passenger and heavy-duty vehicles. Finally, it outlines the process for setting and adjusting these standards, considering factors like economic practicability and technological advancements.
